result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalin L. MANTHE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and/or maintain fulltime employment at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with any of the victims or anyone under the age of 18 without the agent's premission, except her own children.

Defendant is to comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with the sentence imposed on 15 CF 514.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

No contact with any of the victims or anyone under the age of 18 without the agent's permission, with the exception of her own children.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
State files an Amended Information amending count 1 to Exposing Intimate Parts, contrary to Section 948.10(1)&(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   
No contest plea to the amended charge.  Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, sexual assault of child under 16 years of age.   Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Report is due by 04-01-16.   Sentencing hearing is set for 04-08-16 at 8:30 a.m.   Defendant must submit DNA sample. 
Minutes.
Statement of Negotiated Plea.
Amended Information amends count 1 to Exposing Intimate Parts, contrary to Section 948.10(1)&(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Counsel argue.  Court denies the motion to modify bail, but will add a condition that the defendant may have visitation with the child, N.C.B., DOB: 12-09-12 under the supervision of Department of Human Services.   All other conditions will remain in effect.   
Minutes.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification.
to JLF from defendant, re:  modification of bail.
Motion for Bail Modification set for 12/15/2015, at 10:30 a.m.
Philip Hoff, through public defender.
Petition to Withdraw as Counsel of Record and Order.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings. 
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 11-18-2015 at 11:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 02-17-2016 at 3:00 p.m.   
BAIL MOTION
Counsel argue. Court modifies cash bail to $1,500.00. All other conditions still apply. Motion granted.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.
Minutes.
Motion for Bail Modification.
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-30-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the condition that defendant is to have no contact withy B.D.R., DOB: 01-10-2002.   Bail not furnished.   Defendant is remanded to the county jail.   Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.   
Minutes.

RE:  B.D.R., DOB: 01-10-2002, between 12-01-14 and 05-13-15.
Initial appearance is set for 09-28-15 at 2:30 p.m.
